column4: it's a Linksys router? Teach it some manners, install OpenWrt
heres the problem, I was using sveasoft, and it really SUCKED
I was really disappointed because the sveasoft would work great for a short time and then not all all
but the linksys firmware works perfectly
my Sveasoft experience is similar. I'm happy with OpenWrt.
hmm ill check it out, my faith has been shattered due to the sveasoft though
i wish I could just take the linksys firmware and add the setting to crank up the signal strength
in that case, stick with the original firmware. OpenWrt is a whole different kettle of fish.
ok, I am capable of using gentoo, so im not totally clueless about compiling and the such
no, it isn't. You can install a 32bit version if you want to, but the repo version is 64bit
im very surprised at that, I didnt know old flash HAD a 64 bit plugin
it didn't. If you got it working in 64bit firefox, I'd be very curious as to how.
im going to reboot into ubuntu and we're gong to see what's up. brb
it appears I was mistaken - I guess I just assumed it because mplayer-plugin worked
how do I install the 32 bit firefox?
I don't know, I haven't tried, but Kilz has instructions on help.ubuntu.com I think
theres no kinda search function there :(
